title: Trump Launches Fourth NFT Collection with Trading Restrictions and 5M Revenue Potential
summary: Donald Trump released his fourth NFT series, the "America First Collection," featuring 360,000 digital trading cards priced at 9 each with potential revenue exceeding 5 million, while implementing trading restrictions until January 2025 that demonstrated sophisticated market manipulation tactics designed to artificially maintain prices and control secondary market dynamics. The collection generated over .17 million in sales within 24 hours despite representing only 6% of the total potential supply, showing continued exploitation of political supporter loyalty for cryptocurrency revenue generation even during an active presidential campaign. Trump offered exclusive "gala dinner" access at his Jupiter, Florida country club to purchasers buying 75 or more NFTs (,425 minimum), directly monetizing political access through cryptocurrency transactions in a manner that blurs lines between campaign finance and personal enrichment. The implementation of trading restrictions preventing secondary market sales until January 31, 2025, represented a sophisticated pump-and-dump strategy designed to prevent immediate price discovery and maintain artificial scarcity during the initial sales period. By this fourth collection, Trump had earned over  million from NFT ventures according to financial disclosures, establishing a systematic approach to using political celebrity status for cryptocurrency market exploitation while potentially circumventing traditional campaign finance regulations through digital asset sales.
